channel.title: Foodlyweds
channel.description: We're two newlyweds living in Orange County, and to put it simply, we're eating all the things. Donuts. Coffee. Burgers. Boba. Pizza. You name it, we're into it.

item.title: Gourmet Doughnuts and Craft Culinary Creations in the Mile High City
item.description:
Did we eat donuts in Denver? OF COURSE. We’re pretty determined to discover all the delicious donuts there are in the world. (#alliteration) We were lucky to find that this doughtnut shop is connected to Carbon Cafe and the incredible Chef Jason Graf has whipped up some pretty amazing things over on Platte Street.

Here are some of our favorites from the Habit!

With a slogan like “Donuts under the influence. Everyone loves a buzz,” you know you’re in for a treat.

Habit Doughnut:

Raspberry glaze, raspberry streusel, blueberries and white chocolate drizzle. Honestly, this is one of the best doughnuts we've ever had, and we've had a lot. The icing's flavor is somewhat bold, yet not overwhelming. It's rich, yet the fruity, berry flavor balances it out. If we lived in Denver, we'd probably be eating these every day. It's easy to see why they call it the "Habit" Doughnut.

PB&J Doughnut:

Strawberry jam, peanut butter drizzle and candied peanuts. Seriously, this tastes just like PB&J in doughnut form. It's like a time machine right back to your childhood.

S’Mores Doughnut:

First you take the graham, you stick the chocolate on the graham. Then you roast the 'mallow. AND THEN YOU MAKE IT A DONUT. Chocolate glaze, graham cracker crumbles, and ACTUAL TOASTED MARSHMALLOW make this doughnut feel like you're actually camping in the mountains, chillin' by the fire while we eatin' smores doughnuts.

Trailblazer Doughnut:

A cran-orange glaze, with toasted coconut, toasted almonds, brown butter streusel and candied dried cranberries. This doughnut was more mellow than the others, in the best way possible. The nutty flavors, paired with citrus of the orange and tartness of the cranberry gave us the impression of a mixture of Thanksgiving dessert and trailmix, haha. It was absolutely delicious.

And don’t worry - they have gluten free options!

They let us watch their process of creating the Habit Donut, and let us just say - donut design is quite the artform.

They also let us watch them make their Blazed donut (Bruleed malted milk glaze). We were captivated. We’ve never seen anyone torch a donut, but more people should, because this tasted SO GOOD. Grand Marnier, a glazed donut, and a little bit of fire, and you have a culinary masterpiece. A boozy, beautiful masterpiece.

We went into the Habit Doughnut Dispensary expecting delicious donuts, but got so much more! Look at these incredible meals you can order next door.

Carbon Burger:

Grass-fed beef, applewood smoked bacon, swiss, house pickles, DMZ secret sauce, housemade brioche bun. This might have been one of the best burgers we've had. The bacon was thick and crispy, the meat juicy and tender. We could swim in the sauce.

And you guys. Those tots. They’re insane. Fly to Denver now just for the tots. We're not kidding.

Giant Fried Egg Sandwich:

We actually ate this, it's GIGANTIC. Like, bigger than our heads. Like, so big it was a struggle to pick it up and take a bite. The struggle was real, and the struggle was WORTH IT.

All the food that this Carbon was bringing out of their kitchen were so beautifully crafted, we wish we could have eaten it all.

A little bit about the Chef behind these joints:

Jason Graf—the chief enabler of your confection addiction—is an Arizona-bred pastry chef whose culinary cred is best showcased in his buttery brioche creations at Habit. With 12 years of baking and specialty cake design on his resume, it’s no wonder why tricked-out doughnuts are Habit’s calling card.

Make sure you follow all the Habit / Carbon news :

You don't want to be out of the food news loop, do you? Make sure you keep up to date with Foodlyweds!

item.title: National Coffee Day Celebration at SCAA
item.description:
What better way to celebrate National Coffee Day than at the Specialty Coffee Association Open House?! One celebratory cup of coffee wouldn’t have been enough for coffee lovers like us; we had to go somewhere we knew we’d get to try new stuff and experience coffee companies that were new to us. From shakeratos to a nitro golden milk stout beer to the donut selfie wall, we were in for a major treat.

Check out some of the deliciousness we got to partake in!

Blue Bottle, LA

Location: They actually have 26 shops, including some in Japan!

Get their Ready-To-Drink Cold Brew and New Orleans Iced Coffee at the Whole Foods in Tustin, Huntington, Laguna Beach, West Hollywood, and more. So easy to take with you on the go! They also have a subscription service that you can try for free! Their story is pretty fascinating, involving opening the first-ever coffee house in Central Europe, having a 319 year history, and a vow to 48-hour freshness.

Hidden House, OC

Location: San Juan Capistrano, Lake Forest, Costa Mesa

Vision: “Our vision is simple: Hospitality and an on going pursuit of quality.”

The moment you step foot into a Hidden House, you’ll see this vision lived out. All the baristas are always so kind and hospitable and helpful and each Hidden House has its own unique community. The San Juan store is really special to many, many people and is worth checking out. Once you get there, you’ll probably think, “Oh, I’ve definitely seen pictures of this place!.” They also have a subscription service!

Portola Coffee Lab (Theorem), OC

Location: Costa Mesa, Tustin, Santa Ana, Old Towne Orange, Mission Viejo, Huntington Beach (Theorem is at the Costa Mesa shop!)

A little bit about Theorem: "Theorem is a 6-seat coffee concept bar that asks the question: 'Is coffee a beverage or an ingredient?' By answering that question with an emphatic YES, we show customers that it is both...Theorem is a walk-up bar where select baristas are given the creative freedom to develop personalized coffee menus that showcase amazingly creative coffee drinks. The drinks served on these menus vary as much as the baristas do, but have included cocktail-inspired drinks such as a Coffee Sour, an Old Fashioned prepared with slow drip cold-brewed coffee barrel aged in oak for six months, and a cold-brewed coffee sangria, to mention just a few.”

And that is just the type of thing they were serving up! They had three different creative drinks going on, featuring coffee like you’ve never tried it before.

Equator Coffee

Location: Mill Valley, Larkspur, San Francisco

It was our first time trying Equator Coffee and let us just say - that shakerato is LIT. Wow, we could’ve drank 30.

Fun Fact: "In 2011, Equator was the first coffee roaster in the U.S. to become a certified B Corp., solidifying its role as a company that is part of a global movement redefining impact and success in business, while valuing everyone in the supply chain...From [their] farmers’ communities to our local cafés, Equator’s mission is to create a positive impact.”

They are doing so much for the world - so awesome.

The Donuttery

Location: Huntington Beach, CA

We’ve tried a lot of donuts in our day, but never a lemon blueberry one and never hand-picked straight from a donut selfie wall, so that was a fun first.

Shoutout to the SCAA for throwing this, supporting specialty coffee, and having such amazing gifts for visitors on the way out. Oh, and the tacos were fantastic as well.

http://www.scaa.org/

You don't want to be out of the food news loop, do you? Make sure you keep up to date with Foodlyweds!

item.title: 5 Upcoming SoCal Food Events That Have Us Drooling
item.description:
While everybody has their own reason for loving life in Southern California (how could you not love it?!) - the weather, the ocean, the palm trees - our number one reason for celebrating SoCal is this: FOOD!

LA, Orange County, and San Diego are gigantic melting pots of cultural diversity, which makes us the holy grail of global cuisines. You could go travel the globe to consume various dishes of our world's cultures, OR, you could drive up and down the 5, and experience just the same.

The Southern California food scene is a global free-for-all, offering delectable tastes of everything imaginable, from hole-in-the-wall Mexican burritos to five-star, fancy French cuisine, to the ever-trending novelty dessert places (we see you, The Loop, and we're salivating like crazy).

Whether you're looking to be initiated into the SoCal food scene or are a varsity Golden State foodie, you're not going to want to miss these 6 mouthwatering events in Orange County and Los Angeles.

001: Oozefest

Photo Credit: @chompeatery

WHERE: Downtown Santa Ana

WHEN: Saturday October 15TH & Sunday October 16TH // NOON - 10PM

WHAT: Oozefest is a food festival created by the folks over at Foodbeast, and it's all about CHEESE(and beer)!!!

This is a 2-day event with over 30 vendors going all-out to bring you the craziest cheese experience of your life. We're talking mac n' cheese tacos, deep fried cheese balls, and cheesy cotton candy (seriously!).

The craziness doesn't stop there. Some brilliant genius invented a RAINBOW GRILLED CHEESE (aka: Unicorn Grilled Cheese). Just look at that picture up there ^^^. Isn't that wacky?!

If you plan on attending, you basically have two options: 1. Pay $5 for entry to the Oozefest marketplace, gain access to all the vendors, and pay for each item you eat or 2. Buy an All-You-Can-Consume ticket for $40 and eat all the cheese you can fit into your facehole.

There's no way we're missing out on this festival. You better not either.

MORE INFORMATION: http://www.oozefestival.com/

002: Dessert Week LA

WHERE: Pershing Square // Dowtown Los Angeles

WHEN: October 9TH through October 15TH

WHAT: Dessert Week LA is a week to treat yourself! Basically, it's one week out of the year dedicated to the best desserts in the Los Angeles area!

This is the first year this event is happening, but they plan to have it be an annual occurence, which for us is incredibly exciting.

Here's the rundown: Pay $15 and get samples from 10 out of the 25 nominated best dessert spots in LA. Even better, pay $25 for the VIP ticket which lets you try ALL of them. ALL THE SAMPLES. ALL THE DESSERTS. Can you tell we're excited?

It's going to be a really great time, with some of our favorite dessert places being nominated, such as Salt & Straw, Sprinkles, Cream, and so many more!

MORE INFORMATION: http://dessertweekla.com/

003: Bitten LA

Photo Credit: @thisisbitten / @pchyburrs

WHERE: The Gallery Theater of Barnsdall Art Park in Hollywood

WHEN: Friday October 18TH // 8:30AM

WHAT: This one's a little bit different. It's basically TED Talks for food.

If you're interested in the future of food and food technology (let that phrase sink in...FOOD TECHNOLOGY, WHOA!), this is the event for you. Imagine if Steve Jobs, Elon Musk, and Nicola Tesla were in the food industry. This is what would happen.

This is literally how they describe the event on their website: "bringing together today's innovators and thought-leaders — those who are disrupting the food space — to talk about the future of food and how what we build today affects our tomorrow."

We don't really know what "disrupting the food space" means, but it sounds awesome and we're hungry.

To take part in this fancy food disruption, it's gonna cost you quite a bit of change ($200), but you'll probably be able to tell your grandchildren that you attended the event that ended world hunger. (Maybe?)

MORE INFORMATION: http://thisisbitten.com/

004: The Food Event

Photo Credit: @theoffalo / @californiadonuts

WHERE: Saddlerock Ranch, Malibu

WHEN: Sunday October 16TH // 2PM - 5PM

WHAT: This is LA Magazine's 11th Annual Food Event. It's pretty swaggy. The have sommeliers (pronounced: "sum-all-ee-yays"). Basically, wine magicians. You heard it here first - wine magicians will be at this event.

Some delicious vendors are gonna be here, like Salt & Straw (Again! Oh, how we love thee.) and Knuckle & Claw (Oh, how we love thee, as well.) Your best bet is to show up to this event, fill up on ice cream and lobster rolls, and let the wine magicians cast their spell on you.

But seriously, there are 40 vendors hand-selected by LA Magazine's Dine Editor, James Beard. If anybody knows about food in LA, it's him. And he says to go to the Food Event.

It's $125 for unlimited food, wine, and spirits. We'd fork over $125+ for unlimited Salt & Straw alone, so this is a crazy deal. You don't wanna miss out on this!

MORE INFORMATION: http://media.lamag.com/thefoodevent/

005: EAT Show

Photo Credit: @theeatshow

WHERE: The REEF, Los Angeles

WHEN: Saturday October 1st // NOON - 3PM && 6PM - 9PM

WHAT: EAT Show claims it's not a festival, but a celebration of culinary excellence. Yesplease. We're in.

The $50 ticket gets you a taste of each of the 50 vendors. That's $1 per vendor! #foodmath

Some vendors that stand out to us are Halal Guys, Jeni's Ice Cream (SO GOOD), and Street Churros. Churros are the best. Everybody loves churros.

BUT! There's something crazy going down at this event. Are you ready for this? (duh nuh nuh)

ROSCOE'S CHICKEN & WAFFLES FROZEN WAFFLES

Roscoe's basically Eggo-fied their waffles (shout out to Eleven), which means you can buy them, take them home, put them in your freezer, wake up the next morning, and have Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles in the comfort of your own home.

This is revolutionary, people. This is the future. Roscoe's for everyone.

MORE INFORMATION: http://theeatshow.com/

P.S. This will basically be us with Roscoe's Chicken & Waffles

P.P.S. You don't want to be out of the food news loop, do you? Make sure you keep up to date with Foodlyweds!

item.title: Our Trip to Hopdoddy Burger Bar
item.description:
When your meal begins with delicious Parmesan Truffle Fries, Green Chile Queso, Chili Con Queso, and Garlic Aioli, you know you’re gonna have a great time. (We would love to have taken home 8 bottles of that aioli. SO GOOD.)

We made our way over to the new Hopdoddy location on Opening Day and it was overflowing with excitement, delicious smells, and lots of hungry customers. We were happy to be trying this place since we’d heard about it months earlier from a couple friends who said it was at the very top of their Favorite Burger Joints list.

A little bit of Hopdoddy basics as found on their menu:
> THE NAME: HOP because beer and DODDY because it’s the nickname of a tasty cow.
> THE FOOD: the FRESHEST available, all-natural ingredients...

  • Beef from HUMANELY RAISED cows, never ever given growth hormones or antibiotics
  • All meat ground in-house DAILY
  • Fries HAND-CUT from select Kennebec potatoes
  • Buns made FROM SCRATCH and BAKED FRESH every day

We started with drinks and couldn’t wait to try “THE SKINNY DIP” - a 7 oz Coronita Dunked Into a Goblet of Frozen Margarita. There are no words. Except maybe “WOW.” The BLACK CHERRY HARD LIMEADE (Gin or Vodka, Lime, Black Cherry Fizz) was another great one. And why not go for a third? The LIL' PRICK made its way to our table, so together we enjoyed “a sassy Prickly Pear Martini with Silver Tequila and Fresh-Squeezed Lime Juice.” A number of their specialty drinks came with a Black Lava Salt Rim, bumping up the swag level on their cocktails.

Then came the BURGERS.
Selecting burgers was the most challenging part of our meal because EVERY ONE sounded amazing. We were choosing between meats like bison, akaushi beef, lamb, tuna, so narrowing down our options seemed impossible. And we have a confession...we ended up ordering FOUR BURGERS...Hahaha. But don’t worry - we didn’t actually eat all 4 in one sitting.

We did have to save room for shakes. But more on that later. For now, here’s what we ate:

  1. BUFFALO BILL - Bison, Apple-Smoked Bacon, Blue Jack Cheese, Frank's Hot Sauce, Sassy Sauce, Red Leaf Lettuce, White Onion, Beefsteak Tomato (All that for $10?! We’re in.)
  2. AHI TUNA BURGER - Sushi-Grade Tuna, Sprouts, Teriyaki, Honey Wasabi, Nori Chips, Pickled Ginger, Mayo, Red Leaf Lettuce, White Onion, Beefsteak Tomato
  3. PRIMETIME - Texas Akaushi Beef, Brie Cheese, Arugula, Caramelized Onions, Truffle Aioli, Steak Sauce, Beefsteak Tomato
  4. GREEK - Lamb, feta cheese, arugula, pickled red onions, beefsteak tomato, cucumber, tzatziki sauce

Our server asked us which was our favorite, which was a harrrd choice. Each burger was so distinct and different; choosing a favorite would really come down to a craving. Tuna if you’re craving fish. Buffalo Bill if you’re wanting spice. Primetime if you want a classic selection with a touch of excellence. Greek if you’re in the mood for a refreshing, blend of light yet perfectly paired-up flavors. You really can’t go wrong, here at Hopdoddy. Also, isn’t it fun how each burger is branded so accurately on the menu with those carefully selected typefaces? The details, people.

FUN FACT: Each Hopdoddy location has a special burger on the menu called the “Goodnight Good Cause.” When you order this one, $1 goes to a local charity. (At the Tustin location, $1 goes to the Surfrider Foundation of Newport Beach!)

Okay, and now, onto dessert...We ordered the NUTELLA & CHOCOLATE PRETZEL SHAKE and the RED VELVET CAKE SHAKE. We asked how the red velvet cake shake tasted exactly like red velvet and they let us know that they make a fresh red velvet cake batter in house every day and that’s what makes it so good. With every sip, you could taste that this was the real deal. No artificial flavoring business. Just straight up cake batter in a milkshake. Yessss pleaaase.

We had such a good time at Hopdoddy. One of our favorite things about Hopdoddy - aside from the fact that every single thing we tried was incredible - is their top notch customer service. Every single person we met, from the servers to the trainers to the managers, was so nice, conversational, and fun. They all knew so much about the company and really took pride in the Hopdoddy values. With such excellent customer service from employees who really love what they do, attention to detail, true concern for the customer, daily-prepared ingredients, an apparent and powerful vision, Hopdoddy is a total win.

And don’t be discouraged if there’s a long line when you get there. You just may get a cowbell that will get you free fries. Also, online ordering is a thing. Happy Hour is a thing (3:00-6:30). And don’t forget - that garlic aioli is a thing.

Hopdoddy, Tustin Marketplace / 11am–10pm / (714) 505-2337
Website | Instagram
